CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 1 reads: " 'Not for Sale' - The first step in an effort to stabilize the Homewood-Brushton area is the placing of "This House Not for Sale" signs on the property of white families in neighborhood. The plan is designed to defeat the practice of some real estate brokers who encourage white families to sell and move out, then the brokers re-sell the property to Negro purchasers at exorbitant prices.  The Rev. J. David Barkley, left, minister of the Brushton Methodist Church, tacks a sign on his residence at 7718 Hamilton Ave., while Earl J. Huff, right, of 7761 Baxter St., who plans to do the same thing, looks on approvingly - Teenie Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Rev. J. David Barkley tacking sign reading "This House Not for Sale" on his residence, 7718 Hamilton Avenue, with Earl J. Huff on right, Homewood
